company_context: Twill — An open source CMS toolkit for Laravel Twill Logo # MadeWithTwill Demo Chat Blog Guides Docs GitHub Logo GitHub Content management for today’s makers Modern digital products are delightful and dynamic – the tools powering them should be too. It’s time for intuitive, powerful, and flexible publishing experiences. MARCH 2025 — Twill 3.5.0 has been release d! Meet Twill: an open source CMS toolkit for Laravel Publishers Twill makes it a breeze to author and curate compelling narratives and gives you personalized command over fast-paced digital workflows. Designers Twill has design controls in place that ensure the integrity of your design system without restricting the creative needs of publishers. Developers Twill gives you the freedom to create a powerful admin console without compromising developer control, balancing convention with configuration. Own your digital presence We’ve been able to get control of the way we present ourselves like never before. The secret is Twill, which is intuitive, elegant, and even fun. Michael Bierut, Partner, Pentagram Get your entire team involved The design and function of Twill is exceptionally intuitive and fast. Onboarding our team was super easy and helped to get everyone involved. Carissa Ranelycke, Executive Producer, Translation Control your digital workflow Intuitive, user-friendly, elegant and highly reliable, Twill enables several admins with different responsibilities to efficiently manage our site on a daily basis. Sylvain Prévost, Director of Sales and Revenue, Opéra national de Paris Save an enormous amount of time Twill was a game changer for us. We struggled with our old CMS but now it is a pleasure to use, gives us full control and saves us an enormous amount of time. Julia Lafont, Marketing Director, Sonia Rykiel Go beyond content management Twill is the cleanest, fastest and yet most capable admin and design tool we have used in the 15 years of managing our online brand. Exceptional technology. Joseph Wisne, President & CEO, Roto Launch with little extra effort I’ve launched many products without a CMS for lack of time. Now with Twill, I’m able to quickly implement a feature-rich admin panel with little extra effort. Mubashar Iqbal, Product Hunt Maker of the Year 2016 Powerful features, tailored to you Creativity Enjoy creative freedom over how your content is presented. Twill enables you to quickly layout content with built-in controls to ensure design integrity. Visual editor Responsive previewing Hi-res media library Smart cropping Drag & drop featuring Design controls Productivity Invite your entire team with multiple permission levels and see all activity on your dashboard. Track content changes and compare side by side. Activity dashboard Quick-access search Permissions levels Track & compare changes Multi-language Content scheduling Developer experience If you use Laravel, you already know Twill. It encourages you to write beautiful code without bloat while streamlining common fu

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. We're a data processing solution that helps companies like yours optimize their workflow and gain valuable insights. I came across Twill and was impressed with the work you're doing in the CMS space. Can you tell me a bit about your current data management process?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Ah, yeah. We're using a combination of open-source tools and custom scripts to manage our data. It's been working okay so far, but I'm always open to exploring new solutions. What makes DeepData AI unique?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Well, our AI-powered engine can handle large volumes of data and provide real-time analytics. We've seen significant ROI for our clients in terms of time and cost savings. I'd love to discuss how we can help Twill specifically. What are your current pain points when it comes to data management?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: Honestly, our biggest issue is integration. We've got a lot of custom tools and workflows set up, and I'm not sure how easily DeepData AI would fit into our existing infrastructure. Plus, we're in the middle of a major release cycle, so I'm not sure if this is the right time to be evaluating new solutions.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about integration. We've actually worked with several companies in the CMS space and have developed a robust API that can integrate with a variety of systems. As for timing, I'd argue that our solution could actually help you optimize your release cycle and reduce the workload on your team. Would you be open to a demo to see how DeepData AI could work with your existing tools?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the offer, but like I said, we're pretty busy right now. And to be honest, I'm not sure if our budget can accommodate another new solution. We've already got a significant investment in our current data management tools, and I'd need to see some pretty compelling ROI to justify switching.

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I understand that budget is always a consideration. However, I'd like to propose a pilot project that could help us demonstrate the value of DeepData AI to your team. We've had success with similar projects in the past, and I think it could be a great way to test the waters without making a large upfront commitment.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: I appreciate the proposal, but I'm going to have to discuss this with my team and get back to you. We're not really looking to add any new solutions to our stack right now, and I don't think DeepData AI is a good fit for us at this time. Thanks for reaching out, but I think we'll have to pass.

analysis.raw:
Score: 4
Outcome: Failure
Key_Objection: Integration
Feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's integration concerns and provided specific examples or case studies to alleviate these concerns earlier in the conversation. Sentiment: Neutral

parsed.feedback: The seller should have more aggressively addressed the buyer's integration concerns and provided specific examples or case studies to alleviate these concerns earlier in the conversation. Sentiment: Neutral
